author: Sweta Goswami
Jatin Anand
Mohammad Iqbal
text:
Appeals to workers to end strike; unions say it is not enough and will meet Home Minister Rajnath Singh next week

: Even as the Delhi High Court criticised the Municipal Corporations of Delhi (MCDs) for their workers’ strike, Lieutenant-Governor Najeeb Jung offered a Rs. 300 crore loan to two of the three cash-strapped civic bodies here in a bid to bring an end to the agitation by nearly 90,000 municipal employees, which continued to cripple services in the Capital for the tenth day running on Friday.

Hearing a public interest litigation petition, the court asked the AAP government if it intended to invoke the Essential Services Maintenance Act (ESMA) to deal with the situation and issued notices to the municipal bodies as well as the unions representing the safai karamcharis.
title: Jung offers Rs. 300-cr. loan to civic bodies
